s2.ptxt: Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the extension housing bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the extension housing.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION OIL PAN SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove all the magnets and use them to collect steel particles. Carefully look at the foreign matter and particles in the pan and on the magnets to determine the type of wear you will find in the transmission.
Steel (magnetic): bearing, gear and clutch plate wear
Brass (non-magnetic): bush wear

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.

atten4.ptxt: Make a note of the measurement for reference during reassembly.

s2.ptxt: Hold the overdrive direct clutch drum and be turned the input shaft. Check that the input shaft can be turned clockwise but cannot be turned counterclockwise.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place the overdrive direct clutch onto the oil pump.
Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive direct clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the result is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Remove the overdrive direct clutch from the oil pump.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the disc and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the disc and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH PISTON SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Check that the check ball is free by shaking the piston.
Check that the valve does not have leaks by applying low-pressure compressed air.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH DRUM SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the clutch drum bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the clutch drum.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the planetary gear bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the planetary gear.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF OVERDRIVE BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Place the overdrive case onto the transmission case, facing the cutout of the overdrive case downward.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the oil hole of the overdrive case is aligned with the oil hole of the transmission case.

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive brake pack clearance by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Remove the overdrive case from the transmission case.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF FRONT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.

atten4.ptxt: Make a note of the measurement for reference during reassembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF FRONT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: In order to check the piston stroke, install the rear clutch hub.
Install the snap ring.
Using SST and a dial indicator, measure the front clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs and plates are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs and plates.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s2.ptxt: Check that the check ball is free by shaking the piston.
Check that the valve does not have leaks by applying low pressure compressed air.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF REAR CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place the rear clutch onto the center support.
Using a dial indicator, measure the rear clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s2.ptxt: Check that the check ball is free by shaking the piston.
Check that the valve does not have leaks by applying low-pressure compressed air.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 1 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s2.ptxt: Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the center support bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the center support.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 2 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the No. 2 brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s2.ptxt: Hold the No. 1 1-way clutch and turn the sun gear. Check that the sun gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the sun gear bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the sun gear.
Hold the 1-way clutch and inner race and turned the planetary gear. Check that planetary gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear assembly.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the output shaft bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the output shaft.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF NO. 3 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a vernier caliper, measure the clearance between the disc and transmission case, as shown in the illustration.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs and plates are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, and plates.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s2.ptxt: Check that the No. 3 brake pistons move smoothly when applying and releasing compressed air from the transmission case.
Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the transmission bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the transmission case.
